title: Here’s why India’s AI dividend will be earned by legacy manufacturers rather than digital-natives
description: As the India AI Impact Summit puts the spotlight on artificial intelligence adoption, our legacy industries are poised to benefit. That is where the big gains will come. But its success will depend on how ready factories are and how well we roll it out. This is the AI moment we must grab.
content:
Rohit Kansal
4 min read20 Feb 2026, 02:01 PM IST

title: Cheaper AI inference and open architectures essential for mass adoption: Nandan Nilekani
description: Artificial Intelligence serves as a fundamental construct for large-scale societal transformation when integrated with open networks and decentralised ecosystems. Speaking at a panel during the India AI Summit 2026 in Delhi, Nandan Nilekani, Co-founder and Patron of Networks for Humanity, emphasised that the convergence of AI agents and open architectures is the fastest way to diffuse technology productively to improve lives.
content: New Delhi [India], February 20 (ANI): Artificial Intelligence serves as a fundamental construct for large-scale societal transformation when integrated with open networks and decentralised ecosystems. Speaking at a panel during the India AI Summit 20... [2779 chars]

title: 40% Global Jobs Hit, Entry-Level Roles In Danger: IMF Chief's AI Economy Warning
description: An estimated 40 per cent of the global workforce entry-level jobs in particular will be impacted by Artificial Intelligence, IMF chief Kristalina Georgieva warned NDTV Friday, comparing the era-defining technological shift as a "tsunami".
content:
New Delhi:
An estimated 40 per cent of the global workforce – entry-level jobs in particular – will be impacted by Artificial Intelligence and AI-based technological disruptions, IMF chief Kristalina Georgieva warned NDTV Friday, comparing the era-de... [4175 chars]

title: Tata Group Working on Building AI Chips, Says Chairman N Chandrasekaran
description: Tata Group is building artificial intelligence chips, Chairman N Chandrasekaran said, highlighting the conglomerate’s ambitions in semiconductors and advanced AI hardware development.
content:
From data centres to software to semiconductors, Tata Group is engaged heavily in building AI layers, and it has started working on industry-specific AI chips as well, Tata Sons Chairman N Chandrasekaran said on Thursday.
In an interview with PTI at ... [2486 chars]

title: Who is Ranvir Sachdeva? 8-year-old who met Sundar Pichai, Sam Altman and became youngest speaker at India AI Impact Summit 2026
description: An eight-year-old coder, Ranvir Sachdeva, made history as the youngest keynote speaker at the India AI Impact Summit 2026. He shared insights on integrating ancient Indian philosophies with contemporary Artificial Intelligence. Sachdeva also discussed India's AI development approach and his contribution to AI literacy. He met global tech leaders like Sundar Pichai and Sam Altman at the event.
content:

title: AI Summit: PM Modi discusses potential of harnessing AI in agri, edu with top execs
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi met with AI and deeptech startup leaders. They explored using artificial intelligence in agriculture, environmental protection, and higher education. The Prime Minister stressed strong data governance and solutions for India's needs. He expressed confidence in Indian companies and domestic innovation. Startups highlighted India's growing AI ecosystem and global potential.

title: Google Gemini, Apple add music-focused generative AI features
description: Alphabet Inc's Google and Apple Inc are adding music-focused generative artificial intelligence features to their core consumer apps, underscoring how advanced AI tools are moving into mainstream use.
content:

title: AI sovereignty doesn't imply digital isolation: Yotta's Sunil Gupta
description: NEW DELHI, Feb 20: Sovereignty in artificial intelligence (AI) does not imply isolation or complete self-reliance, but rather strategic control, Sunil Gupta, MD and CEO of Yotta Data Services, said on Friday. Speaking at the AI Impact Summit 2026, Gupta stressed that global interdependence in technology is inevitable. “We will always remain interconnected and interdependent across the world.” He further said that some countries will excel at chips, others at raw materials, data, models, talent, or capital, so “collaboration is essential”. […]
